question: Why does readlines() work for reading the rows in a CSV file?

answers.text: readlines() reads line by line using the newline \n character.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: Only specialized libraries recognize a CSV file. The readlines() function assumes that all files being read in are of the same kind.

answers.text: readlines() is not appropriate for reading a CSV file.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: readlines() works well for CSV files. CSV files can also be read with specialized libraries.

answers.text: readlines() automatically recognizes a CSV file and works accordingly.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: The newline \n character indicates where line breaks are in a file and is used by the readlines() function to tell lines apart.

detailedSolution: The newline \n character indicates where line breaks are in a file and is used by the readlines() function to tell lines apart.
